page.title: 07A Typical Day for Mr.Walker
page.content: Mr Walker,the Countryside Interpretive Officer,is a very busy man during the summer because there are many school parties for him to take round the nature trails.Some parties are from as far away as Hull,Goole or Doncaster.Before Mr Walker takes the parties round he has to check the trails to see if there have been any changes in the wildlife since his last survey.Mr Walker tells visitors what to look for and how to find things like birds' nests,animals' homes or rare plants. The ecology of the park can also be studied by visitors making their own way around the nature trails by using the illustrative guides that have been drawn up by the Countryside Interpretive Service.
